data.title: Joss Whedon movie films in N.H.
data.meta_description: New Hampshire realtorBetty LaBranchehasJoss Whedonto thank for some pretty fantastic free advertising. LaBranche’s Exeter office was chosen by movie scouts to serve as the backdrop for significant scenes in the thriller/love story “In Your Eyes,’’ which was written by Whedon, director of the soon-to-be-released blockbuster “The Avengers’’ and creator of the beloved “Buffy the Vampire Slayer’’ TV series.
data.text:
New Hampshire realtor Betty LaBranche has Joss Whedon to thank for some pretty fantastic free advertising.

LaBranche’s Exeter office was chosen by movie scouts to serve as the backdrop for significant scenes in the thriller/love story “In Your Eyes,’’ which was written by Whedon, director of the soon-to-be-released blockbuster “The Avengers’’ and creator of the beloved “Buffy the Vampire Slayer’’ TV series.

“In Your Eyes,’’ which Whedon is also executive-producing, stars Mark Feuerstein of the show “Royal Pains,’’ Michael Stahl-David of “Cloverfield,’’ and Zoe Kazan (granddaughter of “A Streetcar Named Desire’’ director Elia Kazan), who played Meryl Streep’s daughter in “It’s Complicated.’’ LaBranche told us today that the “In Your Eyes’’ crew was in front of her office for most of Sunday, and that she was told by people involved with the production that the Exeter shots are pivotal to the plot. LaBranche laughed, explaining that when the location scout first called her, she didn’t respond. “I thought it was somebody trying to sell me something, so I didn’t return his call for like three days.’’
